greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Order of the rote (rooted odd tree with only exponent symmetries) for n.
comment: A061396(n) gives the number of times that 2n+1 appears in this sequence.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
J. Awbrey, Illustrations of Rotes for Small Integers
formula: a(Prod(p_i^e_i)) = 1 + Sum(a(i) + a(e_i)), product over nonzero e_i in prime factorization of n.
example: Writing prime(i)^j as i:j and using equal signs between identified nodes:
mathematica: a[1] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = 1+Sum[a[PrimePi[i[[1]] ] ] + a[i[[2]] ], {i, FactorInteger[n]}]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 100}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 11 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: Jon Awbrey, Aug 17 2005, based on calculations by _David W. Wilson_
